en.title: Lesson 4 - Git Branch (Team Workflow)
en.subtitle: In this lesson you will fully understand how branches work in real team projects.

sections.title: Why Git Branch Is Needed
sections.description: Branching allows developers to work independently without disturbing the main project.
points: Multiple developers can work at the same time
sections.note: Every professional company uses branching strategy.

sections.title: What Is a Git Branch (Internal Concept)
sections.description: A branch is simply a movable pointer to a commit.
points: Each branch points to a commit
New branch copies the current state
sections.diagram:
main → C1 → C2 → C3
feature → (starts from C3)
sections.note: Branch creation does NOT duplicate files physically.

sections.title: Switching Between Branches
sections.description: Switching means moving your HEAD pointer.
points: HEAD always points to current branch
sections.warning: Always commit or stash before switching branches.

sections.title: Creating and Working in a Feature Branch
sections.description: Let us simulate real development workflow.
sections.note: Each feature gets its own branch.

sections.title: Team Scenario – 3 Developers Workflow
sections.description: Let us assume real company setup.
sections.diagram:
main → C1
login → C2
payment → C3
ui → C4
sections.note: Impossible without branches in real projects.

sections.title: Merging Branches (Preview)
sections.description: After work is completed, branches are merged.
sections.note: We will study merge deeply in next lesson.

sections.title: Common Branching Mistakes
sections.warning: Always double-check branch name before commit.

ta.subtitle: இந்த பாடத்தில் Git Branch முழுமையாக புரிந்து கொள்வீர்கள்.

sections.title: Git Branch ஏன் தேவை?
sections.note: நிறுவனங்களில் branch இல்லை என்றால் project ஓடாது.
